meanings.definition: A book in which daily transactions are recorded.
meanings.sent1: I keep track of all my expenses in my daybook.
meanings.sent2: She wrote down the sales figures in the daybook every evening.
meanings.sent3: The daybook decided to take a day off and relax for once.
meanings.sent4: The daybook was a silent witness to the bustling activity of the store.
meanings.sent5: The daybook, with its neat rows of numbers, was a treasure trove of information.

meanings.definition: A journal or diary for daily entries.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother's daybook is filled with memories of her youth.
meanings.sent2: He carried his daybook with him everywhere to jot down his thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The daybook seemed to have a mind of its own, filling itself with stories.
meanings.sent4: Her daybook was a window into her innermost thoughts and feelings.
meanings.sent5: The worn cover of the daybook held the stories of a lifetime within its pages.
